abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Ninth Power Project
            for Sri Lanka was satisfactory. The project achieved its
            main objectives, its impact on institutional development has
            been substantial, sustainability is likely, and the
            performance of both the Bank and Borrower was satisfactory.
            A few of the key lessons to be learned from this project
            are: 1) detailed designs for the main components should be
            carried out during the preparation stage of the project; 2)
            for supply and erect type of contracts, there should be a
            quick mechanism for the resolution of disputes and the
            mechanism should be incorporated in the bidding documents;
            3) intensive training should be given to project staff on
            material management and inventory control; 4) security risks
            should be properly evaluated and works in security prone
            areas should not be included in the scope of a future
            project; and 5) procurement procedures should be streamlined.
